description: {"blocks":[{"key":"f7euh","text":"This protocol details the expression and purification of coxsackievirus A16 2A protease construct bearing a N-terminal His-SUMO tag at small scale (\u003c6L).\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7noul","text":"Picornaviridae Enterovirus coxsackievirus A16 (CVA16)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"f6mjb","text":"Transform the coxsackievirus A16 2A protease plasmid into BL21(DE3) and store a glycerol stock of this at  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":106,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"befqm","text":"The coxsackievirus A16 2A protease plasmid encodes the 2A protease with an N-terminal His6-SUMO tag on a kanamycin resistant backbone with a T7 promoter.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dpc5c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"2E80FE0AFD6811EE87410A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-80","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1s9os","text":"When the OD600 reaches approximately 3.0, lower the temperature and shaker speed to   and incubate   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":11,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":84,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":99,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cbbms","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"shaker","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":0,"error_shaker":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"shaker":false,"temperature":false},"shaker":"180","start":null,"temperature":"18","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":33}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":0,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":["overnight"],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4nlp2","text":"Perform IMAC to extract target protein from the lysed cell mixture    ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":70}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2v8j8","text":"Wash the column with   of base buffer, followed by   of wash buffer 1 and 2. Allow wash buffer to pass through completely between washes. This is to remove non-specific, weak binding of contaminant proteins from the resin for a cleaner elution. Collect washes separately for SDS-PAGE analysis.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":21,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":51,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":3254}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":3254}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4k7dm","text":"Using an AKTA Pure system:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2g5ek","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7qd2j","text":"Inject the sample onto a 5mL sample loop and run the sample down HiLoad 16/60 Superdex 75 pgÂ gel filtration column at 1 mL/min using gel filtration buffer as the mobile phase, collect 1mL fractions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7v6oh","text":"Lyse cells by sonication on ice     for a total 'on' time of   at 50% amplitude to fully rupture the cells. {"blocks":[{"key":"fdc5a","text":"Wash used IMAC resin with   of base buffer, and leave the column submerged in a small amount of base buffer so that the resin is kept moist. This washed IMAC resin will later be reused for reverse IMAC (rIMAC)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":26,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3lite","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":3254}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3picu","text":"(Optional) elute rIMAC resin with   elution buffer to confirm if the protein shows non-specific binding to the resin used.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":34,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"40cbj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"tpu9","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3a92e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"frase","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6lgqe","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"2","error":false,"guid":"062E8DB6FE5211EE93260A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":3254}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"r8or","text":"This will help determine if the protein is \"sticky\" to the IMAC resin matrix material, and help in further troubleshooting if the final yield is lower than expected. ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6n7at","text":"Despite having a His6 on it the cleaved SUMO tag is usually found contaminating the rIMAC fractions containing coxsackievirus A16 2A protease. The tag can however be removed in the subsequent gel filtration step.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"2":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"guid":"FBB95DDA00B511EF9AFA0A58A9FEAC02","height":353,"id":476093,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"6dbjq\",\"text\":\"SDS-PAGE analysis of IMAC and cleavage fractions. The higher molecular weight band in the right-hand-side gel image, highlighted by red arrow, agrees with the size of cleaved target protein, while the lower band highlighted with blue arrow corresponds to the size of the cleaved SUMO tag (12.372 kDa but band appears at ~15kDa on the SDS-PAGE gels used). Both bands are also observed throughout the IMAC fractions. This is because the coxsackievirus A16 2A protease construct used exhibits auto-cleavage activity during expression and purification. \",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[{\"style\":\"bold\",\"offset\":0,\"length\":49}],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"A71 IMAC and cleave.PNG","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qs79b97zx.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qs77b97zx.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qs78b97zx.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qs76b97zx.webp","width":550}}}}
